**User:**
Hey, I've got some questions about Verus. I've heard some things, but I'm not sure if they're true. Is it true that Verus only allows staking on a single PBaaS chain?

**AI Assistant:**
No, that's not true. You can stake an unlimited amount of PBaaS chains, not just one. This is made possible by the 50% PoW, 50% PoS consensus algorithm used by all these chains. So, you have the flexibility to stake on multiple chains if you want to.

**User:**
That's good to know! I've also heard that you can only merge-mine a maximum of 5 chains with one device on Verus. Is that true?

**AI Assistant:**
No, that's not correct. You can actually merge-mine up to 22 chains with just one device on Verus. So, you have a lot of options when it comes to merge-mining on the Verus network.

**User:**
I've also heard that Verus mining is only available to people with high-end computers. Is that true?

**AI Assistant:**
No, that's not the case. Everyone in the world can start mining Verus today, thanks to their low barrier hashing algorithm, which makes it accessible to people with a wide range of devices.
